page.title: 13THE BRICK KILNS.
page.content: The brick kilns near Hindhay Farm are no longer in use, but the buildings that remain are over 100 years old. The area is similar to an old and derelict building site. It has been fenced off for safety reasons, but it is still possible to see how the buildings were arranged. The Kilns had moss growing over them, and the roof timbers were rotting away. The doors had fallen off their hinges, hanging by a thread like a wobbly tooth. The buildings looked very delicate, as though they would crumble should a mouse move inside. It was easy to imagine the kilns in use; the hustle and bustle, and the smell. Nearby there is a clay pit, and it is probable that many local people relied on these for their livelihood. Now the peace of this once busy site, is the home for wild life.
